reviewText: Well, in chronological order, the Christmas special was released first, the Spring special second, and the OAVs (titled Again) were released last.  That is the order I will talk about them in.Christmas special - 5 starsThis was the best thing to come out of Love Hina in my opinion.  The story of the episode was really sweet, chasing after the thought of a mini-Todai love story.  What I mean by this is that if someone confesses on Christmas, they will love each other and be together forever, so it is said.  The characters take this into account and you see their true feelings and how they want to go about dealing with it.  This is what I think Love Hina is really about.  Since the TV series didn't have much closure and the Spring Special only did so in a mediocre way, I feel this is the episode that I will keep on watching from time to time to remind me of why I love Love Hina.Spring Special - 3 StarsThis was the first true ending to Love Hina until the OAVs came out.  The premise of this special was that Keitaro and Naru took the entrance exam to Todai but Keitaro fell asleep and thought he totally bombed.  Dreadfully ashamed, he left which led to the cast of girls trying to find him.  The search ends on an island, meeting up with a girl named Nyamo.  The point of this is that it is very unfulfilling and that the OAVs did not help but to make the series become even more unfulfilling.Love Hina Again - 1 StarI always wonder, why make more if it doesn't serve any purpose but to ruin the earlier series?  This is what happened.  They introduce a new character, Kanako, who is Keitaro's step sister who is in love with Keitaro as well (big surprise).  This is after Keitaro leaves with Seta on another anthropological trip, leaving the Hinatasou unattended.  All this OAV did was create stupid plot lines and more fan service that just made me sad while watching it because I still remember how much I absolutely loved the TV series.  It didn't give closure to the series that I had put so much heart into.Final Note: Do not get me wrong and think that I am bashing Love Hina.  This series quickly became my favorite for its characters, lightheartedness and story about promise and love.  But I felt that a lot of that got lost on the way.  After the TV series and the Christmas special, I haven't felt that same spark from its other additions.  Love Hina Again turned a lot of the focus on fan service, (which I as a fan, was insulted) instead of keeping the original focus and flow of love as the aspect which they had originally built so beautifully.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own the whole DVD box set, both Movies and Series. And I have also read entire manga or comic books of Love Hina.The manga version include BOTH Series and Movie version of Love Hina. But it is very different from the Series. I guess the manga is more detailed and fun to read. Also the storyline is very different. DVD and manga are telling the same story, but DVD is kinda like director's cut edition.There are many stories shown in manga which have not shown in the DVD. There are also many stories shown in DVD that have not shown in manga.Some people say that manga version is better than the DVD version. I do not totally agree with it. I enjoy watching and read this great masterpiece. I think BOTH are very good and are worth to collect. Some people also say that Spring Movie is very BAD. Well, Over all, I think Spring Movie is not that good compare to the other two movies.Over all, I give this product 4.5/5 STARS! It is a great anime! But none of the anime is PERFECT, just like us human *^_^*If you like love story which is VERY VERY SAD. I highly recommend <<Saikano>>. I just bought <<FLCL>> recently, I think it is also one of the greatest anime ever made!Thank you for reading my review!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Love Hina Christmas Movie DVD is the first you should watch.  Not only does it have Episode 25 as one of the extras, but the movie itself is very touching, as Keitaro finally tells Naru he loves her.  But her reaction, which is to run away, is not the one he wanted.  Does she love him or is she still in love with somebody else?The Love Hina Spring Movie DVD is the next one you should watch.  Naru, Keitaro and Mutsumi have taken their entrance exam for Tokyo U BUT before the results can come in Keitaro disappears.  Naru pretends not to care, but in the end she runs off to rescue him.The story goes nuts, as we end up on a tropical island with a secret civilization, lots of flying turtles, missiles and a girl named Nyamo.  Pretty normal for Love Hina when you think about it.The third DVD, Love Hina Again, is three episodes.  We learn Keitaro and Naru have begun college life.  Yet Naru has still not told Keitaro she loves him (not to his face anyway).  And now he's gone off on another archaelogical dig with Naru's old flame Seta!THEN Keitaro's little step-sister shows up and things really get weird, even for Love Hina.  Talking cats, love magic and lots of new rules to live by.  This DVD also has cool outtakes!If you love Love Hina, you should try to get all the DVDs, used or new.
summary: Three great movies in one collection...
